title: China Donates Equipment to Bunda College of Agriculture in Malawi
description: In a speech on April 5, 2011, ambassador Pan Hejun donated items such as computers, soccer balls, and volleyballs to the Bunda College of Agriculture in Malawi. The financial value for this project cannot be found.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China Donates Equipment to Bunda College of Agriculture in Malawi

# Description
In a speech on April 5, 2011, ambassador Pan Hejun donated items such as computers, soccer balls, and volleyballs to the Bunda College of Agriculture in Malawi. The financial value for this project cannot be found.
justification: Project involves donation of educational equipment with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of computers and sports equipment to educational institution

title: China sends 2nd Medical Team to Malawi (linked to #35417)
description: On March 15, 2011, 10 medical personnel left from Shaanxi province for a medical mission in Malawi. They were joined by 6 remaining personnel from the 1st medical mission (#35417). The 16 member team left Malawi on March 13, 2013.  Since 2008, China has sent a medical team to Malawi about every two years. Part of the team goes to Kamuzu Central Hospital in the capital Lilongwe and another part goes to Mzuzu Central Hospital in Malawi's Northern Region city of Mzuzu.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China sends 2nd Medical Team to Malawi (linked to #35417)

# Description
On March 15, 2011, 10 medical personnel left from Shaanxi province for a medical mission in Malawi. They were joined by 6 remaining personnel from the 1st medical mission (#35417). The 16 member team left Malawi on March 13, 2013.  Since 2008, China has sent a medical team to Malawi about every two years. Part of the team goes to Kamuzu Central Hospital in the capital Lilongwe and another part goes to Mzuzu Central Hospital in Malawi's Northern Region city of Mzuzu.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare provision with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical mission, healthcare personnel, hospital operations

title: Chinese Government donates equipment to Malawi's Parliament (Linked to Project ID#778)
description: On September 27, 2011, the Chinese Ambassador to Malawi Pan Hujen fulfilled an earlier pledge to furnish the new Malawian Parliament building that was completed with financial support from the Chinese Government in 2010 (as captured via Project ID#778). The Chinese Government donated 25 million MWK worth of equipment which included 25 desktop computers and 12 LCD TVs, which were to be used to digitize transcripts of parliamentary debates.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government donates equipment to Malawi's Parliament (Linked to Project ID#778)

# Description
On September 27, 2011, the Chinese Ambassador to Malawi Pan Hujen fulfilled an earlier pledge to furnish the new Malawian Parliament building that was completed with financial support from the Chinese Government in 2010 (as captured via Project ID#778). The Chinese Government donated 25 million MWK worth of equipment which included 25 desktop computers and 12 LCD TVs, which were to be used to digitize transcripts of parliamentary debates.
justification: Project involves donation of equipment for parliamentary operations with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of computers and LCD TVs for digitizing parliamentary debates, no energy-related components

title: Chinese government donates three mobile container scanners to Malawi for major border posts
description: In 2011, the Chinese government donated three mobile container scanners to the Malawian government for major border posts. On March 26, 2012, the scanners were handed over to the Malawi government. The value of the scanners is unknown.

# Title

# Description

justification: Project involves donation of security equipment for border control, with no clear environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Mobile container scanners for border posts, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese government provides scholarships for 29 students
description: On August 27, 2011, a farewell reception was held for 29 Malawi students who won the Chinese government scholarship to study in China for the 2011/2012 academic year. The 29 Malawian Chinese government scholarship students for the 2011/2012 academic year will study undergraduate, master and doctorate degrees in 23 universities in China, specializing in clinical medicine, computing, environmental science, agricultural product processing and many other fields. The return date for the students is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese government provides scholarships for 29 students

# Description
On August 27, 2011, a farewell reception was held for 29 Malawi students who won the Chinese government scholarship to study in China for the 2011/2012 academic year. The 29 Malawian Chinese government scholarship students for the 2011/2012 academic year will study undergraduate, master and doctorate degrees in 23 universities in China, specializing in clinical medicine, computing, environmental science, agricultural product processing and many other fields. The return date for the students is unknown.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education and human development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Scholarships for students in various fields including medicine, computing, environmental science, and agriculture

title: Chinese embassy grants 2 million kwacha for Malawian religious seminar
description: On May 13, 2011, the Chinese embassy granted 2 million kwacha for the "Religious Leaders in Malawi" seminar, led by Rev. Billy Gama, the Malawian President's Advisor on Religious Affairs. The seminar was held on December 9, 2011.

title: ICBC Leasing enters into a sale and leaseback agreement with AirAsia for four Airbus A320 aircraft
description: In 2011, ICBC Financial Leasing Co., Ltd. (ICBC Leasing) entered into a sale-and-leaseback agreement with Capital A Berhad (AirAsia), a Malaysian low-cost airline, for four Airbus A320 aircraft. The terms of this agreement are unknown.
staff_comments: 1. Sale and leaseback (or sale-leaseback) agreements are generally considered to be off-balance-sheet hybrid debt products.
